title: Help with a font
content:
Hi everyone

Wonder if anybody knows if this belongs to a font, or whether it has been custom desgined?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014232030im_/http:/typophile.com/files/73ringring2_4909.jpg)
author: guille80

comments.content:
It's a variation on the famous & by Caslon, so it looks very familiar:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014232030im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CaslonClassicoBoldItalic_4429.jpg)
  
Ampersands are the place for creative play by font makers, so it could well be from a font -- if so, probably a high contrast thick & thin.  
It would take some time to go through the candidates to check for a precise match.  
The & symbol is also a popular art project.  
Perhaps one of the cognoscenti with a good memory could pronounce on this one.  
BTW, ampersands have been discussed before in typophile forums. You might enjoy browsing through:  
 [http://typophile.com/search/node/ampersand](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014232030/http:/typophile.com/search/node/ampersand "http://typophile.com/search/node/ampersand")  
Don
you can also check out Eva Black Designs [ampersand post](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014232030/http:/evablackdesign.com/2012/01/ampersands.html)

Came across [Hera Big Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014232030/http:/soyuz.tumblr.com/post/2891210835/hera-is-a-font-family-in-three-weights-the-family), which has an ampersand with the same thick & thin flavor of your image.  
Don
